meanings.definition: To confirm or attest to the truth or accuracy of something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was certifying that the students' answers were correct.
meanings.sent2: The notary public was certifying the authenticity of the signature.
meanings.sent3: The detective was certifying the alibi of the suspect, leading to a surprising twist in the case.
meanings.sent4: The scientist was certifying the results of the experiment, ensuring the validity of the findings.
meanings.sent5: The judge was certifying the evidence, making sure it was undeniable in court.

meanings.sent1: The government agency was certifying the new regulations.
meanings.sent2: The board of directors was certifying the financial report.
meanings.sent3: The mayor was certifying the parade route, causing excitement in the town.
meanings.sent4: The principal was certifying the school event, giving it official recognition.
meanings.sent5: The committee was certifying the project, granting it the necessary approval.

meanings.definition: To provide with a certificate or official document.
meanings.sent1: The university was certifying the graduates with their diplomas.
meanings.sent2: The company was certifying the employees with training certificates.
meanings.sent3: The zoo was certifying the animal adoption with personalized certificates.
meanings.sent4: The organization was certifying the volunteers with appreciation certificates.
meanings.sent5: The government was certifying the businesses with licenses and permits.
